a:r.a:t: How to use the Wavestone ppt template
As part of its CSR* approach, Wavestone is committed to create an inclusive working environment, in particular by ensuring
digital accessibility for all. Here are a few good practices to adopt to enable everyone, and in particular people with disabilities,
to see, read and understand your documents.
Make maximum use of the elements provided by the Slide Master (title insert, shapes, fonts, colours)
Only use one Slide Master per presentation (
do not import slides from old templates)
Set document language according to content language
*Slide Master (accessible via the "View" tab) controls the appearance of your presentation (background, fonts, etc.)
Include an "Alt Text“* when a visual has a meaning, otherwise mark it as "decorative"
(≠ from a simple literal description) enables a blind or partially-sighted person to understand the meaning of the image when playing back the presentation
Right-click the object and select “Edit Alt Text”, select the format menu for the object and then select “Alt text”
Stick to the fonts and colors suggested in the Slide Master
Do not tone down text (e.g. image legend)
Do not use text sizes that are too small (minimum 12
Don't forget table and row/column titles
Avoid overloaded slides (one strong idea per slide)
Systematically explain the titles of links (don't just say "
For French speakers, avoid using anglicized French (“franglais”) or change language in the "Review" tab, then "Language"
level of your presentation by going to
